symptoms: 6-month-old with fever 40°C, lethargic, poor feeding, weak cry, fontanelle bulging
rationale: Infant with concerning signs, possible meningitis or sepsis

symptoms: 2-year-old with severe difficulty breathing, retractions, nasal flaring, O2 sat 88% on room air, wheezing
4-year-old with high fever 39.5°C for 2 days, pulling at ear, crying, not eating well
rationale: Likely otitis media, needs evaluation and treatment

symptoms: 18-month-old with vomiting and diarrhea for 2 days, decreased wet diapers, dry lips, lethargic
5-year-old with fever 38.5°C, runny nose, cough for 3 days, eating and drinking okay
3-year-old with mild runny nose, no fever, eating and playing normally
rationale: Mild URI, supportive care at home
